definition: stray bullet
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
crossball/bullet/shot/shell/ball
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: Coffie , a taxi driver, was hit by a stray bullet during the fighting.
sentences.chinese: 卡菲是一位出租車司機，在戰鬥期間被流彈擊中。

sentences.english: A stray bullet struck his steel helmet and glanced off.
sentences.chinese: 一顆流彈擊中他的鋼盔，又彈了開去。

sentences.english: The seventh was apparently killed by a stray bullet.
sentences.chinese: 第七人很明顯是被流彈所殺。

sentences.english: Children now play outside without fear of stray bullets.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們現在在外面玩不用擔心流彈。

definition: to smash
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
rocket (artillery)
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
western style guns (in former times)
to attack with a bladed weapon
trench/entrenchment
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
sound of gong
able-bodied man (capable of fighting in a war)
toy gun
turmoil/social upheaval
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
submachine gun
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
